result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy A Matelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs to be paid during first 18 months probation. Submit DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete psychological evaluation and follow all treatment. Take all medications as prescribed. Follow Chapter 51; abide by all terms. Surrender all weapons. Probation review to be done in six months.

Defendant Troy A Matelski in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.
Reading waived.

Defendant Troy A Matelski in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one without enhancer. Sentencing statements by attorneys. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 3 years probation, conds: $518 costs, payable during first 18 months of probation. Submit DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete psychological evaluation and follow all treatment. Take all medications as prescribed. Follow Chapter 51; abide by all terms. Surrender all weapons. Probation review to be done in six months. Cts. 2&3 dismissed and read in. 51 days jail credit.
Bail/bond hearing at 02-04-2016 02:00 pm
Bail/bond hearing at 01-21-2016 02:00 pm
